info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 5:05PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
At 505 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm producing a landspout near Canal Point. This storm was nearly stationary.
HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts of 45 to 50 mph, and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Palm Beach County.
info.instruction:
These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes.
Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

parameter.value: A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Palm Beach County through 545 PM EDT
